Alright, here's a full breakdown I made on exh so I'll just post it here too --- Basically, Akina and Kouta has a mutual like for each other. Neither of them takes the initiative. Akina is just waiting for those magic words "I love you."
Since Bull is upfront about what he likes, he takes her first. Akina told the bull that she didn't want to stay just as friend with Kouta, Bull then says the magic words to her face, something that Kouta never said to her. Those magic words + amazing sex = she was absolutely smitten.
Akina and Kouta meet in the street, then Kouta was like "There's something I wanted to tell you... ah well, nevermind."
So Kouta never did manage to say "I love you" until it was too late.
Akina did feel dirty about it, how she could've also taken the initiative so she could be together with Kouta. But then she thinks to herself that Kouta deserves someone else better than her.
Final page: Bull says "I love you" to Akina once again and she replies "I love you too."

The future for the both of them is clear as crystal anyway, the MC looking smug af in the ending (chapter 2 as believed) author hinted a candidate for him even before the preludes, these preludes were the past and 1-3 was the present one I suppose?, it's 50/50 in the support, pretty fair I guess. As for her I can't look up in the sky without shit in my eye, as for what sharp said before regarding her future I highly agree. FMC just wanted to be love like any other girl for her first, I'd assume she misinterpreted good sex for good love, antagonizing her own future. Ending 50/50 for our main lead.

@SchrodingerZ Oh hell yeah, 80% chance she's not gonna have a great future. She will reap what she sowed, which she is clearly aware of that's why she decided that Kouta deserved someone else better than her. But whether or not she gets dumped by the bull in the future, I'm sure that Kouta's gonna be there to catch her if she falls. I'm sure Kouta hates himself for not taking the initiative, but he doesn't (and shouldn't) hate her for being in a relationship that he had nothing to do with.
